After they've gotten too much positive attention, a prairie drake is apt to murder a farm animal or destroy croplands only to prove that they're far from harmless.

action->Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet

action->Dirt Breath.name: Dirt Breath
action->Dirt Breath.description: The prairie drake spits a ball of dirt that explodes into a shower of rocks and mud. The attack has a range of 30 feet and explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true]). Plant creatures in the area take no damage on a successful save; regardless, once per day, plant creatures can spend 10 minutes in the area to absorb the nutrients and heal [[/r 1d8[healing]]]{1d8 Hit Points}. The prairie drake can't use Dirt Breath again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Breath weapon]]{1d6 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The prairie drake makes one jaws Strike and two wing Strikes in any order.

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The prairie drake Strides or Burrows twice.

action->Whipping Wing.name: Whipping Wing
action->Whipping Wing.description: Roxy makes a wing Strike against a target within reach. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the end of its next turn.

Rust Ooze.name: Rostschlick
Rust Ooze.publicNotes:
Diese rot-braunen Klümpchen schlängeln sich auf der Suche nach Eisenrohren, Metallabfällen und anderen Objekten, die rosten, durch die Abwasserkanäle und andere Wasserläufe.

Die Umweltverschmutzung in Städten und die Forschungen der Alchemisten bringen alle möglichen Arten von neuen und interessanten Schlickkreaturen hervor.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Bewegungsgespür 60 Fuß/18 m
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Ein Rostschlick kann durch Vibration und Luft- oder Wasserbewegungen in der Nähe befindliche Kreaturen wahrnehmen.

action->Corrode Weapon.name: Waffenkorrosion
action->Corrode Weapon.description:
Auslöser Der Rostschlick wurde mit einer metallenen Waffe getroffen

Effekt Der Rostschlick fügt dem Gegenstand @Damage[2d6[acid]]{2W6 Punkte Säureschaden} zu und ignoriert dabei die Härte.

action->Metal Resistance.name: Metallresistenz
action->Metal Resistance.description: Ein Rostschlick hat eine Resistenz 5 gegenüber Metallwaffen.

action->Rust.name: Rost
action->Rust.description: Wenn ein Rostschlick mit einer Scheingliedmaße einen Kritischen Treffer zufügt, fügt er einem Metallgegenstand, den das Ziel trägt oder hält, @Damage[2d6[acid]]{2W6 Punkte Säureschaden} zu und ignoriert dabei die Härte des Gegenstandes. Falls die Kreatur die Reaktion Schildblock gegen den Scheingliedmaßenangriff des Rostschlicks einsetzt, ist das Schild automatisch beschädigt, aber es rostet kein anderer Gegenstand.

action->Tetanus.name: Tetanus
action->Tetanus.description:
Offene Wunden können zu dieser Infektion führen, welche dann zu Steifheit, Muskelkrämpfen, die stark genug sind, um Knochen zu brechen, und schließlich zum Tod führen kann.

Rettungswurf @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Verzögerung 10 Tage

Phase 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 1} (1 Woche)

Phase 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 2} und kann nicht sprechen (1 Tag)

Phase 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Gelähmt} mit Krämpfen (1 Tag)

Phase 4 Tod

action->Quickest Draw.name: Schnellste Waffenbereitschaft
action->Quickest Draw.description:
Anforderungen Scharkosa ist sich mindestens eines Gegners bewusst und nicht @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} betroffen; Auslöser Scharkosa würfelt Initiative

Effekt Scharkosa führt zwei Nahkampfangriffe aus oder sie zieht ihre Pistole und führt einen Fernkampfangriff aus, jeweils gegen einen Gegner, dessen sie sich bewusst ist.

action->Concussive Fist.name: Erschütternder Faustschlag
action->Concussive Fist.description:
Eine lebende Kreatur, die von Scharkosas Schlagring getroffen wird, muss einen @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]{Zähigkeitswurf} ausführen.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur erhält für die nächsten 24 Stunden temporäre Immunität gegen diese Fähigkeit.

Erfolg Die Kreatur ist nicht betroffen.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrt}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand Verwirrt sowie den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Liegend}.

action->Golden Bullets.name: Goldene Kugeln
action->Golden Bullets.description: Scharkosas übernatürliche Verbindung zum Material Gold ermöglicht es ihr, die Flugbahn ihrer Patronen mit goldenen Hülsen in der Luft zu verändern. Solange ihr Ziel sich innerhalb von 120 Fuß/36 m von ihr befindet, erhält sie einen Situationsbonus von +1 auf Fernkampfangriffe gegen Ziele mit Leichter Deckung und von +2 gegen Ziele mit normaler oder Starker Deckung.

action->One-Two Punch.name: Eins-Zwei-Schlag
action->One-Two Punch.description: Scharkosa führt drei Angriffe mit ihrem Schlagring aus. Jeder dieser Schläge wird wie üblich zur Berechnung des Malus für Mehrfachangriffe herangezogen.

action->Reload Trick.name: Trickreiches Nachladen
action->Reload Trick.description:
Anforderungen Es befinden sich keine Gegner innerhalb von 60 Fuß/18 m von Scharkosa und ihre Duellpistole ist geladen

Häufigkeit einmal pro Minute

Effekt Scharkosa führt zwei Angriffe mit der Duellpistole aus und lädt dabei nach jedem Schuss nach.

action->Sneak Attack.description: Scharkosa fügt Kreaturen, die ihr gegenüber @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} betroffen sind, 2W6 Punkte zusätzlichen Präzisionsschaden zu.

Scarecophagus.name: Schreckophag
Scarecophagus.publicNotes: Der ursprünglich während des Kriegs gegen Nex von gebbitischen Nekromanten erschaffene Schreckophag ist ein böses Konstrukt, das seine Kraft direkt aus der Mumie bezieht, die für immer in seinem versiegelten Inneren gefangen ist. Diese nekromantische Energie wird durch den gesamten Körper des Konstrukts fokussiert. Sie erlaubt es ihm, auf steinernen Beinen zu krabbeln und den gefangenen Geist der Mumie als seine eigene Weisheit und für magische Kräfte zu nutzen.

action->Magic Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Magiegespür (ungenau) 30 Fuß/9 m
action->Magic Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: Der Schreckophag spürt die Anwesenheit von magischen Gegenständen und Zaubersprüchen innerhalb von 30 Fuß/9 m wie mit einem ungenauen Sinn.

action->Despair.name: Verzweiflung
action->Despair.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 Fuß/9 m} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Lebende Kreaturen, die sich in der Verzweiflungsaura des Schreckophags befinden, erhalten den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 1}. Sie können sich nicht von dieser Furcht erholen, solange sie in der Aura verweilen, verlieren aber den Zustand nach ihrem Verlassen augenblicklich. Betritt eine Kreatur erstmals die Aura, muss sie einen @Check[type:will|dc:22]{Willenswurf} ablegen (nachdem der Malus aus Verängstigt 1 genommen wurde) oder erhält für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Gelähmt}. Im Anschluss ist die Kreatur für 24 Stunden gegen diese Lähmung temporär immun.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1bOSJ2LbEC28aI9f]{Effekt: Verzweiflung}

action->Disgorge Mummy.name: Mumie freisetzen
action->Disgorge Mummy.description: Wird der Schreckophag durch Schaden, abgesehen von Positiver Energie, auf 0 TP gebracht, bricht er auf, da er zerstört wurde, und bringt die untote Mumie, die seit Äonen in seinem Inneren gefangen war, hervor. Sie ist eine schwächere @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.E5RDV3n7GnjAspQ5]{Wächtermumie}; sollte die Wächtermumie alleine für 1 Monat überleben, verliert sie die Anpassung als schwächere Version. Falls der Schreckophag durch Positive Energie auf 0 TP gebracht wird, bricht er auf, da er zerstört wurde, und die darin befindliche Mumie zerfällt ebenso zu Staub, da auch sie zerstört wurde.

action->Vulnerable to Positive Energy.name: Empfindlichkeit gegen Positive Energie
action->Vulnerable to Positive Energy.description: Der Schreckophag nimmt von Lebensschaden Schaden, als ob er eine untote Kreatur wäre.

action->Sarcophagus.name: Sarkophag
action->Sarcophagus.description: Bis zum nächsten Mal, wenn er wieder handelt, erscheint der Schreckophag wie ein Sarkophag. Er hat ein automatisches Ergebnis von 34 auf Täuschungswürfe und SG, um sich als Sarkophag auszugeben.

action->Shifting Scuttle.name: Wuselnder Schritt
action->Shifting Scuttle.description:
Häufigkeit einmal pro Zug

Effekt Der Schreckophag führt einen Schritt mit bis zu 10 Fuß/3 m aus.

Second Kiss Engine.name: Second Kiss Engine
Second Kiss Engine.description: Exposed clockwork gears spin at high speeds.
Second Kiss Engine.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Disable the engine|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to disable the engine, or @Check[type:engineering-lore|dc:26|name:Disengage the drive shaft] to disengage the drive shaft. Either method disables the trap but also shuts down the engine, disabling the Second Kiss's propulsion.

action->Spinning Gears.name: Spinning Gears
action->Spinning Gears.description:
Trigger A creature Strides in the engine nacelle

Effect The creature's clothing or limbs get caught in the spinning gears and axles of the engine. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(4d8+18)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature's clothing is pulled into the clockworks. The creature takes @Damage[(4d8+18)[bludgeoning]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. Until the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 24), it takes @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage each round as it's pulled into the spinning rotors. A creature wearing clothing can automatically Escape by doffing its caught clothing; this destroys the doffed clothing.

Shock Zombie.name: Shock Zombie
Shock Zombie.publicNotes: Shock zombies are hideous undead covered with bolts and electrical wiring. Most have two large electric coils mounted on their backs to absorb and project electricity. If uncontrolled, shock zombies often wander far afield in search of inventors' labs or lightning storms to draw power from. In a pinch, the natural electric currents inside living creatures more than suffice.

action->Electricity Absorption.name: Electricity Absorption
action->Electricity Absorption.description: For 1 minute after taking electricity damage, a shock zombie loses its usual @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} condition, gains the ability to use reactions, and gains a +10-foot status bonus to its Speed.

action->Lightning Powered.name: Lightning Powered
action->Lightning Powered.description:
Arcs of restorative electricity jolt between shock zombies. For each shock zombie within 30 feet, the shock zombie gains fast healing 2 (to a maximum of fast healing 10).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MxFFGo4WJpHh1e70]{Effect: Lightning Powered}

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A shock zombie is typically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions (but see electricity absorption).

action->Infused Items.name: Aufgeladene Gegenstände
action->Infused Items.description: Schoma Lyzerius führt 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{durchschnittliche Flaschenblitze}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{schwache Lebenselixiere}, 6 durchschnittliche Lyzeriumphiolen, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{durchschnittliche Säureflaschen} und 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.T6Appwwl6nUl56Xj]{schwache Verstrickungsbeutel} mit sich. Diese Gegenstände halten 24 Stunden lang oder bis er das nächste Mal seine täglichen Vorbereitungen trifft. Er kann eine einzelne Aktion aufwenden, um eine weitere Dosis eines dieser Gegenstände herzustellen oder eines der Gegenstände, deren Formeln in seinem Formelbuch stehen.

action->Far Lob.name: Weitwurf
action->Far Lob.description: Lyzerius’ Bomben haben eine Entfernungseinheit von 30 Fuß/9 m (statt 20 Fuß/6 m).

action->Firebug.name: Feuerteufel
action->Firebug.description: Lyzerius’ alchemistische Gegenstände fügen bei einem erfolgreichen Angriff zusätzlich @Damage[1[fire]]{1 Punkt Feuerschaden} zu.

action->Natural-Born Burner.name: Brennendes Naturtalent
action->Natural-Born Burner.description: Jede Nahkampfwaffe, die Lyzerius führt, fügt zusätzlich @Damage[1d6[fire]]{1W6 Punkte Feuerschaden} zu.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Schneller Bombenwerfer
action->Quick Bomber.description: Lyzerius nutzt eine Aktion der Kategorie Interagieren, um eine Bombe hervorzuholen und dann einen Angriff für den eigentlichen Angriff.

Skeletal Crocodile.name: Skeletal Crocodile
Skeletal Crocodile.publicNotes:
Huge giants and other enormous creatures make powerful skeletons.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

action->Broad Swipe.name: Broad Swipe
action->Broad Swipe.description: The crocodile makes two Strikes with its tail against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

action->Reconfigure.name: Reconfigure
action->Reconfigure.description: Part machine and part skeleton, the crocodile reconfigures its mechanical components, either reducing its size to Large or returning its size to Huge if it is currently Large.

action->Skull Shot.name: Skull Shot
action->Skull Shot.description: The skeletal crocodile detaches its skull and fires it at a target within 30 feet, making a bite Strike. If the Strike is successful and the target is Large or smaller, the crocodile uses a heavy chain to retract its skull back to its body, dragging the targeted creature 30 feet.

Slick.name: Slick
Slick.publicNotes: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings. Their eyes are capable of peering in different directions independently, making them almost as difficult to sneak up on as they are to notice in the first place.

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check.

action->Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
action->Tongue Grab.description: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

weapon->Bola.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YUzPv0i8d8p2J9yx]

This throwing weapon consists of weights tied to the end of long cords, which can be used to bludgeon foes or entangle their legs.

action->Weeping Wounds.name: Weeping Wounds
action->Weeping Wounds.description: The fluid in a Sludgespine's pustules is harmful to other creatures. Whenever a creature hits a Sludgespine killer with a melee attack, the attacker must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:14] save or take @Damage[1[acid]] damage (@Damage[2[acid]] damage on a critical failure).

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: A gnoll deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll's allies.

action->Stealthy Abduction.name: Stealthy Abduction
action->Stealthy Abduction.description: When a Sludgespine killer successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapples} a creature, that creature makes no sound; other creatures can't notice the grapple by hearing alone. As long as it's grappled, the creature can't use actions with the auditory trait or cast spells with a verbal component.

Smog Giant.name: Smogriese
Smog Giant.publicNotes:
Pervertierte magische Stürme und unmoralische Ingenieure brachten den ersten der sogenannten Smogriesen hervor. Diese jähzornigen Behemoths stammen alle von einem Stamm unglücklicher Bergriesen ab, der sich ganz besonders stark auf die seltsame Umgebung eingestellt hatte, sodass er einzigartige Mutationen und unglaublich gewalttätige Veranlagungen entwickelt hatte. Trotz all ihrer körperlichen Abnormitäten, muss man fairerweise sagen, dass die gewalttätigen Auseinandersetzungen, die entlang der Westlichen Verheerung üblich sind, der wahre Grund für die monströse Natur der Smogriesen sind.

Smogriesen können zwar Fleisch und Knochen essen, aber sie bevorzugen als Nahrung Schwarzpulver und die Rohstoffe, aus denen dieses alchemistische Machwerk erzeugt wird. Ihre Körper besitzen Speicher für diese Sachen, zusammen mit instabilen okkulten Energien, die ihr Fleisch durchsetzen. Das erlaubt es ihnen, wenn sie angreifen, die unter der Haut befindlichen explosiven Taschen „knacken“ zu lassen, ähnlich wie das brutale Knacken ihrer Knöchel während eines Kampfes. Nur sind in diesem Fall die Ergebnisse viel heftiger – vor allem durch die große Menge an waffenartigen Körperpiercings und Verzierungen, welche die Smogriesen häufig tragen.

action->Explosive Headbutt.name: Explosiver Kopfstoß
action->Explosive Headbutt.description:
Der Smogriese knackt seinen Nacken, wodurch Taschen mit Schwarzpulver an der Schädelbasis entstehen, die seinem Angriff zusätzliche Kraft verleihen. Der Smogriese versucht dann einen Kopfstoßangriff. Dieser zählt als zwei Angriffe, wenn der Malus für Mehrfachangriffe des Riesen berechnet wird. Wenn dieser Angriff trifft, verursacht er @Damage[(2d10+8)[bludgeoning]]{2W10+8 Wuchtschaden} und die getroffene Kreatur muss einen @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]{Zähigkeitswurf} ablegen.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur erleidet keine weiteren Auswirkungen.

Erfolg Die Kreatur nimmt zusätzlich @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning]]{1W10 Punkte Wuchtschaden}.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur nimmt zusätzlich @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]]{2W10 Punkte Wuchtschaden} und wird @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{zu Boden geworfen}, wenn sie der Größenkategorie Groß oder kleiner angehört.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie Fehlschlag, aber ohne Begrenzung der Größe.

action->Shrapnel.name: Schrapnell
action->Shrapnel.description: Ein Smogriese besitzt ein Dutzend implantierte Messer, Felsen, Metallstücke, Stacheln und andere Verzierungen, die er aus seinem Körper mit großer Kraft verschießen kann, um Schrapnell-Fernkampfangriffe zu machen. Hat der Smogriese alle 12 Schüsse verbraucht, muss er sie nacheinander in einer Interagieren Aktion von 1 Minute Dauer ersetzen.

Smog Wraith.name: Smog Wraith
Smog Wraith.publicNotes:
Clouds of choking fumes and toxic smog continuously shroud these potent undead. They constantly belch forth noxious vapors and find great humor in the death of creatures too weak to resist their vile fumes. These fetid vapors are so dense the corpses of a smog wraith's victims can float among them.

Though it's possible to create smog wraiths through necromancy, most are the result of industrialists, inventors, and polluters who in life relished opportunities to exploit nature for profit, power, or prestige. In death, these wretched souls can rise as smog wraiths to continue their spoliation.
Smog Wraith.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

action->Floating Corpses.name: Floating Corpses
action->Floating Corpses.description: A smog wraith's victims are imbued with an eerie buoyancy; corpses of such creatures float up to 30 feet in the air while inside the wraith's noxious smog aura, though the wraith has no control over the corpse's movement.

action->Lifesense 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]
Lifesense 60 feet

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Posit.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

action->Noxious Smog.name: Noxious Smog
action->Noxious Smog.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures within the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and creatures outside the aura are concealed to creatures within it. A creature that ends its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} while within the cloud.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and slowed 1 while within the cloud.

action->Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
action->Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A smog wraith caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

action->Smog Wraith Spawn.name: Smog Wraith Spawn
action->Smog Wraith Spawn.description: A living humanoid slain by a smog wraith's noxious hand Strike rises as a smog wraith spawn after [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the smog wraith that killed it. It doesn't have noxious smog or smog wraith spawn and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it's a smog wraith spawn. If the creator of the spawn dies, the spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous smog wraith; it regains its free will, gains smog wraith spawn and noxious smog, and is no longer clumsy.

action->Acidic Pustules.name: Acidic Pustules
action->Acidic Pustules.description: The marauder's skin is covered with necrotic boils that burst when struck. Whenever a creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the marauder, each creature within 5 feet takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]). On a critically failed save, a creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,acid]] damage.

action->Runic Resistance.name: Runic Resistance
action->Runic Resistance.description:
Trigger The marauder takes damage from a Strike or spell effect

Effect The marauder's protective runic tattoos glow, granting them resistance 5 to one damage type dealt by the triggering attack.

This resistance applies against the triggering effect and lasts for 1 minute or until the marauder uses this ability again, whichever comes first. If the triggering effect deals multiple damage types, the marauder chooses which type to resist.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.P4bNtDVyknQwjTPo]{Effect: Runic Resistance}

action->Mana Fever.name: Mana Fever
action->Mana Fever.description:
A creature can't remove the fatigued condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 day)

Stage 4 gain immunity to mana fever and become a Mana Wastes mutant

action->Paired Strike.name: Paired Strike
action->Paired Strike.description:
Requirements The maftet is wielding two scimitars

Effect The maftet makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their scimitars. The maftet combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as one attack when calculating the maftet's multiple attack penalty.

action->Powerful Scimitars.name: Powerful Scimitars
action->Powerful Scimitars.description: Any non-magical scimitar becomes a +1 striking scimitar while a spellscar sky marauder wields it.

action->Raptor Dive.name: Raptor Dive
action->Raptor Dive.description:
Requirements The marauder is flying at least 10 feet above the target

Effect The marauder Flies up to twice their fly Speed and makes a Paired Strike at the end of the movement. If both Strikes hit, the target is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Steaming Kingdom Bartender.name: Steaming Kingdom Bartender
Steaming Kingdom Bartender.publicNotes:
Barkeeps are often friends and mentors within a community, lending an ear while supplying libations. The best barkeeps have some talent for storytelling and passing on valuable advice.

Countless adventures begin in a tavern or a pub. Maybe it's because such places attract the risk-prone, or maybe it's because everyone needs a little liquid courage before they decide to take on a group of rampaging ogres.

equipment->Pewter Mug.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.wRSS5vP8ltrThsoC]
Pewter Mug

consumable->Flask of Whiskey.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UMAXLDpI6YLSfYX1]
Flask of Whiskey
consumable->Flask of Whiskey.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UMAXLDpI6YLSfYX1]

Alcohol is a common substance available in stunning variety. The Price of a dose of alcohol depends on the specific beverage. You can't recover from the sickened condition from alcohol while affected.

If you fail a saving throw against alcohol other than initial saves, the affliction's stage doesn't increase; the only way to increase the stage of alcohol's affliction is to consume more alcohol.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:12]

Onset 10 minutes

Stage 1 +1 item bonus to saving throws against fear (10 minutes)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, +1 item bonus to saving throws against fear effects (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, off-guard, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 4 clumsy 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 5 clumsy 2, sickened 2, and stupefied 2 (10 minutes)

Stage 6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (8 hours)

Stage 7 death

action->Bar Brawler.name: Bar Brawler
action->Bar Brawler.description: The barkeep has been in enough bar fights to know how to throw a few punches. When fighting in their bar and making a nonlethal attack, the barkeep gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls and deals an additional [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage}.

action->Barkeep's Advice.name: Barkeep's Advice
action->Barkeep's Advice.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The barkeep gives some pertinent advice to a single creature other than themself. For 24 hours, when that creature fails a skill check or saving throw, they can recall this advice and reroll the check, using the second result instead. Once that creature uses this ability, its effect ends.

A creature that receives the Barkeep's Advice is temporarily immune to the ability for 1 month.

Stink-Sap Trap.name: Stink-Sap Trap
Stink-Sap Trap.description: A nozzle attached to a pressure sensor under the flagstone path sprays thick wads of smelly sap.
Stink-Sap Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:15|name:Clog the nozzle|traits:hazard,mechanical,trap] (trained) to clog the nozzle or @Check[type:athletics|dc:14|name:Redirect the stream|traits:hazard,mechanical,trap] (trained) to redirect the stream away from the path; the Athletics check can be made at a distance with a thrown object, but a critical failure triggers the trap's Sudden Spray.
Stink-Sap Trap.reset: 1 minute. The trap resets automatically twice before the supply of stink sap is exhausted.

action->Sudden Spray.name: Sudden Spray
action->Sudden Spray.description:
Trigger A creature or object weighing at least 50 pounds is placed on one of the flagstones north of the gate (marked "T" on the map)

Effect Pressurized sap sprays from the nozzle, coating everything in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Creatures in the area that fail a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20|traits:hazard,mechanical,trap] save become affected by stink sap.

action->Stink Sap.name: Stink Sap
action->Stink Sap.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures and their equipment coated in the sap smell horrible. Creatures in the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16|traits:hazard,mechanical,trap] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is immune to stink sap for 1 minute. Creatures don't save against this effect in exploration mode and don't become temporarily immune, but creatures with stink sap on them must roll against their own aura when they roll initiative in encounter mode. The sap dissipates after 10 hours; spending 10 minutes scrubbing the sap off with soap and water reduces the duration by 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TcgvhgpUkJFjVqBx]{Effect: Stink Sap}

Subduing Gas Chamber.name: Subduing Gas Chamber
Subduing Gas Chamber.description: A mechanical sensor in the desk drawer releases a counterweight in the wall, which slams the door shut and opens the sleeping gas tank under the bed, allowing gas to fill the air-tight room with a hissing sound.
Subduing Gas Chamber.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Disconnect the wire|traits:hazard,complex,mechanical,trap] (Trained) to disconnect the wire to the counterweight, preventing it from falling, or @Check[type:crafting|dc:20|name:Create a counteragent|traits:hazard,complex,mechanical,trap,alchemical,action:craft] (Alchemical Crafting) to create a counteragent to the sleeping gas
Subduing Gas Chamber.routine: (1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more sleeping gas into the room. Any breathing creature in the room is exposed to the toxin. If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone breathing in the poison-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. The trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended, after which it rapidly decays over the next minute. Opening the door to an adjacent room cuts the remaining time it takes for the gas to decay in half but exposes creatures in that room as well.

action->Slam Door.name: Slam Door
action->Slam Door.description:
Trigger A creature opens the desk drawer without holding the release button under the desk

Effect The wooden door to the room slams shut and locks, and the trap rolls initiative.

action->Sleeping Gas.name: Sleeping Gas
action->Sleeping Gas.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|traits:hazard,complex,mechanical,trap]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 3 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1 hour)

Swee Pup.name: Swee Pup
Swee Pup.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

action->Broken Legs.description: Swee Pup's lower half doesn't function as a result of damage sustained, reducing its Speed to 0 feet. Repairing such a complex and rare prototype is beyond the ability of anyone but Kosowana without months of research.

action->Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
action->Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of its donor soul's personality, though none of that creature's memories. This causes a soulbound doll to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits.

action->Lamp Vision 30 feet.name: Lamp Vision 30 feet
action->Lamp Vision 30 feet.description: The Claws of Time is specially attuned to the crystal lamps in the Cradle of Quartz. It can sense creatures within 30 feet of any crystal lamp in the Cradle of Quartz. These lamps are marked as glowing blue dots on the map. This is a precise sense.

action->Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
action->Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the hound with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:29|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Ripping Gaze.name: Ripping Gaze
action->Ripping Gaze.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The Claws of Time's eyes glow balefully, causing painful but bloodless wounds to rip open in the body of a creature that meets its awful gaze. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it takes @Damage[6d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true] save).

A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Vulnerable to Curved Space.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
action->Vulnerable to Curved Space.description:
When a hound of Tindalos is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90º (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. It can't recover from this sickened condition, but the condition ends automatically once the hound is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.V60TWjo1G1r5ZtPM]{Effect: Vulnerable to Curved Space}

action->Angled Entry.name: Angled Entry
action->Angled Entry.description:
The Claws of Time casts a 4th‑level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell, but it must transport itself into a space adjacent to an angle of 90º (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. This means the hound can use dimension door to appear adjacent to any wall or corner in the Cradle of Quartz except for the central geode (area D16).

Once per day, the hound can use this ability to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Plane Shift} to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles next to which it can appear.

Trapjaw Tangle.name: Trapjaw Tangle
Trapjaw Tangle.publicNotes:
Sometimes the best intentions result in dire consequences and even a successful project can turn into an unending nightmare. Such is the grim tale of the first trapjaw tangles. These mechanical swarms were initially created as a solution to the pestilence of mutated rodents that plagued Alkenstar. These mobile rat traps, bound together by a magical matrix of occult energy, were programmed to wait in ambush or chase down their prey. The first trapjaw tangles proved effective and their creators were well rewarded for their ingenious designs. Soon trapjaw tangles were deployed throughout Alkenstar, Martel, and the Gunworks. Waves of them would be sent to roam into the Spellscar Desert, and the ever-present vermin were quickly forgotten.

Then disaster struck. A rogue wave of magical energy washed over an airship that carried a trapjaw tangle in its hold. The magical affliction scrambled the tangle's programming and gave the swarm just enough intellect to send it on a red frenzy through the ship. When the airship crashed into the outskirts of Alkenstar, its crew perished but the infected tangle survived to infect every trapjaw it met with the same deadly scrambling of magic. Now, trapjaw tangles are an even greater menace to society than the vermin they were originally designed to eradicate.

action->Cling.name: Cling
action->Cling.description:
Trigger A creature leaves the trapjaw tangle's space

Effect The swarm takes [[/r 1d6]]{1d6 damage} as individual traps cling to the creature and continue chewing, dealing @Damage[2d10[persistent,slashing]] damage. High winds or electricity damage reduces the DC of the flat check to end this persistent damage by 5. Any area damage dealt to the creature destroys these clinging trapjaws.

action->Snapping Jaws.name: Snapping Jaws
action->Snapping Jaws.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d10[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]). Creatures that fail this save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} from the numerous painful wounds caused by the swarm.

action->Trip and Tangle.name: Trip and Tangle
action->Trip and Tangle.description:
Requirements A creature in the trapjaw tangle's space took damage from the swarm during this round

Effect The trapjaw tangle attempts an @Check[type:athletics|traits:trip-tangle] check with a +10 modifier against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the trapjaw tangle's next turn. On a critical success, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Flash of Insight.name: Flash of Insight
action->Flash of Insight.description:
Trigger Vewslog is about to roll a d20

Frequency once per day

Effect The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

action->Pistolero's Retort.name: Pistolero's Retort
action->Pistolero's Retort.description:
Trigger A foe within 60 feet critically fails an attack roll against Vewslog

Effect Vewslog makes a dueling pistol Strike against the triggering foe.

action->Deadeye.name: Deadeye
action->Deadeye.description: Vewslog's ranged attacks deal an additional 4d6 precision damage.

action->Firearms Critical Specialization.name: Firearms Critical Specialization
action->Firearms Critical Specialization.description: When Vewslog makes a critical hit with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Ricochet.name: Ricochet
action->Ricochet.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Vewslog makes a ranged Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within 60 feet of Vewslog. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A ricochet counts as two attacks for Vewslog's multiple attack penalty.

Volatile Reagents.name: Volatile Reagents
Volatile Reagents.description: Potion bottles, alembics, and potent ingredients violently explode when jostled and accidentally combined.
Volatile Reagents.disable: Three @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20|name:Sort and separate the ingredients|traits:alchemical,hazard,complex,environmental] or @Check[type:crafting|dc:20|name:Sort and separate the ingredients|traits:alchemical,hazard,complex,environmental] checks to sort and separate the bottles of volatile ingredients into groups
Volatile Reagents.reset: The lab contains enough ingredients for this hazard to last 1 minute before all materials are expended. Alternatively, the hazard resets once Slick shrinks to regular size.
Volatile Reagents.routine: (1 action) A random 10-foot square in Gattlebee's laboratory explodes, dealing [[/r 2d6]] damage to creatures and objects in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:18|basic:true|traits:alchemical,hazard,complex,environmental]). The damage type is randomly determined each round: acid, cold, electricity, fire, slashing, or sonic.

action->Explosive Catalyst.name: Explosive Catalyst
action->Explosive Catalyst.description:
Trigger Slick drinks Gattlebee's growth serum

Effect The giant lizard bumps into lab tables and workbenches, causing dangerous ingredients to intermix and detonate. The hazard rolls initiative.

Wooden Bullets Trap.name: Wooden Bullets Trap
Wooden Bullets Trap.description: A hopper full of wooden sling bullets is attached to several launching devices, which spew the bullets at high velocity through various holes in the boards covering the window. A distinctive "click" and whirring sound indicate the trap has been sprung.
Wooden Bullets Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17|name:reinforce the porch sensor|traits:complex,hazard,trap,mechanical] (trained) to reinforce the porch pressure sensor or @Check[type:crafting|dc:15|name:Cover the holes|traits:complex,hazard,trap,mechanical] (trained) to cover the holes launching the bullets
Wooden Bullets Trap.reset: The trap stops after 10 rounds or when the weight on the porch is removed, whichever comes first. The trap can operate for a total of 10 rounds before its ammunition is exhausted.
Wooden Bullets Trap.routine: (2 actions) The wooden bullets trap Strikes the two nearest creatures. It ignores @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creatures as the bullets fly overhead.

action->Auto-Sling.name: Auto-Sling
action->Auto-Sling.description:
Trigger A creature or object weighing at least 50 pounds is placed on the porch (marked "T" on the map)

Effect A stream of wooden sling bullets flies from a launcher. The trap Strikes the two nearest creatures and then rolls initiative.

Yeast Ooze.name: Hefeschlick
Yeast Ooze.publicNotes:
Wildhefe und Alchemie verbinden sich zu diesem monströsen, schäumenden Schlick.

Die Umweltverschmutzung in Städten und die Forschungen der Alchemisten bringen alle möglichen Arten von neuen und interessanten Schlickkreaturen hervor.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Bewegungsgespür 60 Fuß/18 m
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Ein Hefeschlick kann durch Vibration und Luft- oder Wasserbewegungen in der Nähe befindliche Kreaturen wahrnehmen.

action->Monstrous Yeast.name: Monströse Hefe
action->Monstrous Yeast.description:
Immer, wenn eine Kreatur, die mit der Monströsen Hefe infiziert ist, Kälteschaden nimmt, darf sie einen neuen Rettungswurf mit einem Situationsbonus von +2 ablegen. Ein Fehlschlag lässt das Leiden nicht fortschreiten.

Rettungswurf @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Verzögerung 1 Runde

Phase 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} (1 Stunde)

Phase 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Geschwächt 1} und Auf dem Falschen Fuß (1 Stunde)

Phase 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Geschwächt 2} und Auf dem Falschen Fuß (1 Tag)
